Summary After graduating from Brigham Young University with a degree in Marketing, I am currently working at Google as an Associate Account Strategist. 
 
During the past several years, I have concentrated my efforts in developing skills where I can contribute in the Digital Marketing space. I have become an online marketing specialist with an expert knowledge of Google AdWords (PPC) and Web Analytics. I love working with people, both internally and externally, and I have a strong background and experience in sales, customer service, and people management.  
 
I thrive in team, results-oriented environments; and I enjoy the challenge of leading, motivating, and engaging with team members to accomplish a common goal. Experience Associate Account Strategist Google June 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, California I help small- and medium-sized businesses utilize Google advertising products to increase ROI and achieve campaign specific goals. I achieved high client satisfaction evidenced by a cancellation rate of less than 2 percent. Marketing Intern Qazztek, LLC January 2012  –  April 2012  (4 months) I developed a marketing plan and business recommendations for prospective IT Security course implementation. I conducted extensive Interviews and focus groups to identify potential market as well as client needs and preferences. I designed strategies to further course development and penetrate the target market. Summary Guvanch Meredov is a thriving 23-year-old polyglot (6 languages) from Turkmenistan, who has knowledge and experiences gained from various occupations in 6 countries he has resided in across Asia, Europe, and North America as a result of his academic pursuit and professional endeavors. He holds a BSc degree in Industrial Engineering from Fatih University with senior year studies of Engineering Management from the University of Southern Denmark. Guvanch has also successfully finished his MSc course in Engineering Business Management with Distinction and finalized his research in the field of Creativity and Innovation with Distinction at the University of Warwick (Class of 2014). Organizations such as the Nippon Foundation (Japan), European Commission (EU), and the British Council (UK) have supported him in his aspirations. While his area of expertise is circled around Engineering Business Management with specializations in Manufacturing, Project Planning & Management, and Supply Chain & Logistics, Guvanch possesses fundamental skills in Data Analysis, Finance, Marketing, and so on as may be observed and inferred further below. He is currently employed as an Associate Account Strategist at Google's EU/EMEA Headquarters and serves as the University of Warwick's Ambassador to the Republic of Ireland. Summary I've a passion for innovation and start-ups. 
 
I am currently an Associate Account Strategist at Google on the Global Customer Experience team. My role entails helping businesses to grow and develop with Google's latest online products and solutions.  
 
I am also the Programme Lead for Google's Adopt A Startup initiative. In 2015, we worked with 20 of Ireland's leading Startups to develop their digital marketing strategies over a 90 day period.  
 
My main areas of interest are business strategy, new venture development, innovation, venture capital and marketing.  
 
I recently graduated from Trinity College Dublin with a Bachelor of Business (Honours) degree.  
 
From February to July 2013 I participated in the Trinity College International Exchange Programme, living and studying in Shanghai, China where I attended Tongji University. It was an incredible experience to live and learn in China and I hope that my future business dealings give me an opportunity to one day return. Summary I am motivated, collaborative and socially responsible young professional with interest in Business Consulting and Marketing. Currently, I am a senior student in American University in Bulgaria (AUBG), double majoring in Business Administration and Political Science. 
 
Born in Russia, raised in Azerbaijan, educated in Bulgaria, and working in the USA and Poland, I am growing to become a truly global citizen who works hard to follow his motto: "Learn, Grow, Give". 
 
I recently completed my internship at Google where I consulted small-and-medium businesses to run effective online advertising campaigns. During the internship I was also managing and growing Google B2B social media channels earning broad marketing experience. 
 
I have earned extensive international leadership experience through serving as a President of Student Government, organizing of the first TEDxAUBG event, founder of the MIND Intellectual competition, and attending numerous international conferences in the USA.  
 
For my contribution to community service and international education, in 2010 I was awarded USA Presidential Volunteer Award by the Cabinet of Barack Obama. Meanwhile, I am an active contributor to development of education abroad in my home town in Azerbaijan. 
 
I enjoy to spend my free time hiking, playing golf and reading books about personal growth. Summary I am motivated, collaborative and socially responsible young professional with interest in Business Consulting and Marketing. Currently, I am a senior student in American University in Bulgaria (AUBG), double majoring in Business Administration and Political Science. 
 
Born in Russia, raised in Azerbaijan, educated in Bulgaria, and working in the USA and Poland, I am growing to become a truly global citizen who works hard to follow his motto: "Learn, Grow, Give". 
 
I recently completed my internship at Google where I consulted small-and-medium businesses to run effective online advertising campaigns. During the internship I was also managing and growing Google B2B social media channels earning broad marketing experience. 
 
I have earned extensive international leadership experience through serving as a President of Student Government, organizing of the first TEDxAUBG event, founder of the MIND Intellectual competition, and attending numerous international conferences in the USA.  
 
For my contribution to community service and international education, in 2010 I was awarded USA Presidential Volunteer Award by the Cabinet of Barack Obama. Meanwhile, I am an active contributor to development of education abroad in my home town in Azerbaijan. 
 
I enjoy to spend my free time hiking, playing golf and reading books about personal growth. Clinical Research Assistant Washington University School of Medicine January 2012  –  May 2014  (2 years 5 months) Greater St. Louis Area I interned as a clinical research assistant on The ATTRACT Trial, a study designed to improve the quality of life of patients with deep vein thrombosis.

I additionally worked closely with my mentor to conduct a literature review on the benefits and downfalls to using quality of life assessments.
